courseInfo.prerequisite: Basic knowledge of R, L, C, Diode, Transistor

rationale: Electrical, Electronic, Instrumentation and allied engineering diploma holders are required to use and maintain various types of electronically controlled equipment. The fundamental principles of electronics are to be applied in most of the situations to arrive at the probable solutions which is faced in the world of work, therefore the knowledge of the functions of various basic electronic devices and components and practical skills acquired through the laboratory experiments will help them, when they work with electronic equipment and its sub-circuits. This course is designed to develop the skills to use the basics electronic components and apply the knowledge to maintain the various types of electronic circuits.

content: Junction field effect transistor(JFET) structure, symbol, working, characteristics, parameters
Metal oxide semiconductor field effect transistor(MOSFET)
Depletion type MOSFET. structure, symbol, working, characteristics

courseContent.unitTitle: Transistor Biasing circuits And Thermal stability
content: Biasing of Amplifier and Definition of Operating Point
The Load Lines: D.C. Load Line and A.C. Load Line
Biasing Methods
Stability Factor: Definition and features
Compensation techniques for bias stability
Thermal Runaway, Thermal Resistance & Thermal Stability
Heat Sink and its types
Amplifier Parameters Gain, Bandwidth and Gain Bandwidth product
Effect of Emitter Bypass Capacitor and Coupling Capacitor on frequency response
Frequency Response of Single Stage Amplifier
Gain of multi-stage amplifier
Different Coupling Techniques for cascading: Direct, RC, LC and Transformer
Frequency Response of Two Stage RC Coupled amplifier
Concept of feedback in amplifiers: Negative and Positive
Types of feedback
Voltage gain of feedback amplifier
Describe the effect of negative feedback on amplifier parameters like Gain, input impedance, output impedance, stability, bandwidth, frequency response, distortion, and noise
List the advantages and disadvantages of negative feedback
Emitter follower circuit
Use of positive feedback in oscillators
Barkhausen's criteria for oscillation
Overall gain of positive feedback amplifier
Tank circuit
Different types of oscillators
LC oscillators: (1) Hartley oscillator, (2) Colpitts oscillator
RC oscillators: (1) Phase shift oscillator, (2) Wein bridge oscillator
Crystal Oscillator Piezoelectric effect, characteristics of crystal, crystal oscillator circuits
Uni junction transistor(UJT) Structure, symbol, working, characteristics
Use of UJT as relaxation oscillator

practicalOutcomes.outcome: Build and test voltage divider biased type amplifier and measure voltage at different points on the circuit and observe waveforms
Test thermal stability of fixed biased type amplifier

Test the performance of negative feedback amplifier and compare gain, BW with amplifier without feedback
Build / test Colpitts oscillator for variable frequency
Build / test Hartley oscillator for variable frequency
Build / test UJT as a Relaxation Oscillator
